intro: Clutia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf clutia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, black seeds.
